channel.title: Productivity on Sinling
channel.description: Recent content in Productivity on Sinling

item.title: Must know shortcut keys in Jupyter Notebook
item.description: As a developer, we should always follow the rule: If you start doing some action with the mouse, stop and think if there is a shortcut. If there is one - use it. In this document, I will list down several shortcut that I find useful in navigating Jupyter Notebook. Note: These shortcut can be applied to both Jupyter Notebook and Jupyter Lab, except for the customized shortcut, which is only available in Jupyter Lab as far as I understand.

item.title: Add Keyboard Shortcut R's Pipe Operator (%>%) to Jupyter Lab
item.description: Recently, I have started using JupyterLab to write data science blog posts in both R & Python languages. I have found out that the keyboard shortcut in R Studio for pipe operator (%>%) Ctrl + Shift + M is not working in JupyterLab. Since I am used to %>% shortcut in RStudio, why not I add that into Jupyter Lab? To do this, we would need to edit the settings for JupyterLab’s keyboard shortcut plugin.
